paragraphs.text:
Streaming applications are
  1. Simple Java programs with a main
  2. In production the ideal is that the fatjar (see pom.xml) should be deployed for every broker
  3. There are
    • Stateless Streams: The messages stream through the app and are not (temporary) stored.
    • Statefull Streams: With some grouping algorithm a certain state is created.
  4. The application has a certain topology:
    • the source is one or more topics
    • the target is zero or more topics
    • and in between some operations
  5. There are 2 prgramming models
    • Low-level Processor API
    • High-level Streams DSL
  6. We will limit ourselves with the high level DSL..
Our simple pomis nothing special, only now kafka-streams is really used

Testdata: we made a sandbox with test data, we will use this test data to study all the tricks with streaming.
Starting with lesson 20 we will become serious.

It is possible to map the value of the messages to another value, see Look here for 'MapValues'.
This is the most simple mapping.
Less simple, even problematic (why?), is mapping where also the key changes!!
In this example we let persons move from province to another province, and store the result in the same topic. Have attention on the recursion!!
We will do it more often, we read from a topic, do a transformation, and store the message again in the same topic. We will do this often: storing a message back in the topic with a changed state.
The previous exercise maps the value. In this example we change the key, see Look here for 'SelectKey'.
